13.2. Cost and Benefit Data

This section presents Table 20, which summarizes the costs and benefits related to ecosystem-based coastal management and monitoring systems in Jamaica. The data include restoration of coral reefs and mangroves, as well as enhancements to flood early warning systems. These actions contribute to climate resilience by protecting coastal areas, improving biodiversity, and preventing disaster-related losses.

Table 20. Costs and Benefits for Coastal Restoration and Monitoring Systems**

Data point description

Source

Cost: Use of ecosystem approach in management of beaches - Coral Reef Restoration (Reattachment of detached coral): small-scale relocation

World Bank Group. Beach Restoration and Coastal Management Guidelines: Jamaica. Retrieved from https://www.gfdrr.org/sites/default/files/publication/Coastal%20Management%20and%20Beach%20Restoration%20Guidelines%20Jamaica%20FINAL.pdf

Cost: Coral Reef Restoration – large-scale relocation

World Bank Group (2020)

Cost: Coral Reef Restoration – artificial reef creation

World Bank Group (2020)

Cost: Coral Reef Restoration – coral reef nurseries

World Bank Group (2020)

Cost: Mangrove Restoration – planting (removal of fouling materials)

World Bank Group (2020)

Cost: Mangrove Restoration – relocation (removal of fouling materials)

World Bank Group (2020)

Cost: Mangrove Restoration – afforestation (removal of fouling materials)

World Bank Group (2020)

Cost: Increasing number of monitoring stations, real-time water level and rainfall intensity monitoring

Caribbean Development Bank. (2017). Upgraded Flood Early Warning System for Rio Cobre Watershed - Jamaica.

Cost: Mechanisms for relaying real-time data to stakeholders

Caribbean Development Bank (2017)

Benefit: Coral reefs – Ecosystem services, excluding recreation and tourism

Brander, L. M., et al. (2024). Ecosystem Services, 66, 101606. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.ecoser.2024.101606

Benefit: Mangroves – Ecosystem services, excluding recreation and tourism

Brander, L. M., et al. (2024)

Benefit: Early warning systems – Annual losses prevented from hurricanes and floods

Caribbean Development Bank. (2017). Upgraded Flood Early Warning System for Rio Cobre Watershed - Jamaica.
